{"step_by_step_thinking": "Asphyxial injury in a term baby is characterized by seizures, altered sensorium, and difficulty in clearing oral secretions. These symptoms are mentioned in the documents as common signs of asphyxial injury. However, differential hypotonia (lower limbs > upper limbs) is not mentioned as a characteristic of asphyxial injury in any of the documents.", "answer_choice": "B"}
